channel.title: AI Agents on Rotational Labs
channel.description: Recent content in AI Agents on Rotational Labs

item.title: AI Agents and Tools: Unlocking Business Impact
item.description:
Tools: How AI Agents Get Real Work Done

Now that we’ve covered AI agents in general, and prompts and LLMs specifically, let’s move on to tools.

item.title: Making Sense of LLMs
item.description: Now that we’ve covered agents at a high level and prompts specifically, let’s move to the next component in our series: Large Language Models (LLMs), a key subset of generative AI. In an agentic framework, LLMs serve as the “brain” or decision-execution component of the agent.

item.title: Prompts: The Key to Steering Agents
item.description: AI agents have the ability to complete tasks autonomously, but without clear, well-structured prompts, they stumble. Prompt engineering helps bridge the gap between potential and performance.

item.title: AI Agents Defined: Practical, Probabilistic, and Purposeful
item.description: AI agents represent a significant opportunity for businesses, provided they’re designed for real business impact. This potential has become especially viable as cost-efficient reasoning models become increasingly accessible. While there’s no single standard definition, here’s our perspective.
